name: Epic 13: Sitter-to-Creator Conversion
description: The viral loop — sitters become creators.

userStories.title: Sitter-to-creator prompt
userStories.description: As a sitter who has used Handoff, I want to be gently prompted to create my own so the product grows virally.
acceptanceCriteria: After trip ends, sitter view shows: 'Loved using Handoff? Create one for your own home.' with CTA button
CTA leads to signup page with context ('You were [Owner]'s sitter — now make your own')
Also shown as a subtle banner in the manual view during active trips (non-intrusive)
Never gates any sitter functionality behind signup
Tracks conversion: sitter link -> creator signup attribution
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: Load /convex-best-practices to add attribution tracking: when the sitter opens a trip link (US-067), store the tripId in session storage as originTripId. In the signUp action (convex/authActions.ts), accept an optional originTripId argument and record it in a Conversions table (sitterUserId, originTripId, convertedAt) for analytics. Write a getPropertyOwnerName query (public, accepts tripId) that returns only the owner's first name for the conversion prompt messaging — no other owner data. Load /nextjs-best-practices to implement the post-trip and in-manual prompts: (1) in src/app/t/[shareLink]/page.tsx, when getTripByShareLink returns status='EXPIRED', render the post-trip conversion card before the 'This handoff has ended' message; (2) in the manual sitter view (US-036), add a non-intrusive fixed bottom banner during active trips. Both CTAs link to /signup?ref=[tripId] which the signup page reads to pre-fill context. Load /tailwind-design-system to render: (1) the post-trip conversion card as bg-bg-raised rounded-xl shadow-md p-8 text-center with font-display italic headline 'Loved using Handoff?', body text 'Create one for your own home.', and a btn-primary CTA — warm and editorial, not salesy; (2) the in-manual banner as a slim bg-primary-subtle text-primary rounded-lg px-4 py-2 bottom bar with a single line of text and a text link, easily dismissible. Never wrap sitter content in a signup gate. Use /dev-browser to verify: the post-trip card appears on an expired trip link, the in-manual banner is visible but non-intrusive during active trips, the CTA navigates to /signup with the ref param, dismissing the banner removes it for the session, and sitter functionality works without signing up.
